channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Bull trap? It's 'make or break' time for U.S. soft landing case, strategist says
item.description: "Certainly we could get an in excess of 10% correction into the 15% mark or more."

item.title: Online disinformation sparked a wave of far-right violence in the UK â€” here's how
item.description: It didn't take long for false claims to appear on social media after three young girls were killed in the British town of Southport in July.

item.title: Ukraine unleashes large drone attack on Russian airfield as Kyiv's offensive continues
item.description: Ukrainian drones struck a key military airfield in Russia's Lipetsk region, as Kyiv continues its largest offensive on Russian soil since the start of the war.

item.title: Maduro orders 10-day ban on Elon Musk's X in Venezuela after feud with billionaire
item.description: Contested Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro ordered a 10-day ban on X, cutting off locals' access to the platform after a feud with Elon Musk.

item.title: Container explodes on cargo ship at China's key Ningbo port
item.description: A hazardous goods container exploded Friday on a ship operating in China's Ningbo Port, vessel owner Yang Ming told CNBC in a statement.

item.title: SoftBank-backed Indian EV startup Ola Electric pops 20% on debut valuing firm at $4.8 billion
item.description: Shares of Ola Electric surged 20% on their market debut as investors bet the company is set to become a key player in India's EV industry.

item.title: UK investment platform Hargreaves Lansdown agrees to $6.9 billion takeover by CVC consortium
item.description: Hargreaves Lansdown, the U.K.'s biggest stockbroker, said it had agreed to $6.94 billion by a consortium including CVC Capital Partners.

item.title: 10-year Treasury yield dips as traders weigh state of U.S. economy after latest data
item.description: U.S. Treasury yields were slightly lower early Friday as investors continue to assess weekly jobless claims data.

item.title: China will have nearly twice as many pets as young children by 2030, Goldman Sachs says
item.description: The country's urban pet population is set to hit over 70 million by the end of the decade, while the number of children under the age of four will dwindle to less than 40 million.

item.title: Wealthy investors find opportunities in stock market sell-offs
item.description: Wealth advisors say their clients saw the drop in stock prices as an opportunity for tax savings and estate planning.

item.title: China's consumer prices pick up more than expected in July, up by 0.5%
item.description: China's consumer prices rose by a more-than-expected 0.5% in July from a year ago, according to data from the National Bureau of Statistics on Friday.

item.title: Musk-Trump alliance: Why the onetime enemies are teaming up to try to win the White House
item.description: Elon Musk endorsed Donald Trump on X moments after the attempted assassination of the former president at his Pennsylvania rally on July 13.

item.title: More than half of new cars sold in China are now electric or hybrid
item.description: New energy vehicles outsold traditional fuel-powered passenger cars in July, according to China Passenger Car Association data.

item.title: More Chinese EV makers debut in Singapore as the city-state boosts adoption with incentives, more charging points
item.description: More Chinese electric vehicle brands are launching in Singapore as the government pushes for EV adoption with extended incentives and charging points.

item.title: Malaysia's prime minister lauds country's burgeoning chip hub status as Infineon opens new plant
item.description: Multinational companies have increasingly looked to increase their presence in the Southeast Asian nation as they diversify operations amid U.S.-China tensions.

item.title: Jeremy Siegel backs off on calls for the Fed to do an emergency interest rate cut
item.description: Siegel no longer thinks it's vital for an emergency interest rate reduction, but still wants policymakers to cut quickly and aggressively.

item.title: Weekly jobless claims fall to 233,000, less than expected, in a positive sign for labor market
item.description: Initial claims for unemployment insurance were expected to total 240,000 for the week ended Aug. 3.

item.title: 3,000 evacuated, state of emergency declared after Ukraineâ€™s raid into Russia
item.description: A state of emergency has been declared in Kursk following a Ukrainian incursion into the Russian border region.

item.title: CNBC's Inside India newsletter: Could India be a hedge for a U.S. recession?
item.description: Nifty's 50 outperformed U.S. and Japan stocks during the last sell-off and they've started to beat the S&P 500 this year.

item.title: Trump and Harris agree to Sept. 10 debate on ABC, two more dates in the works
item.description: Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump held a news conference at Mar-a-Lago as he tries to slow the momentum of Democratic rival Kamala Harris.

item.title: Catalan separatist Carles Puigdemont returns to Spain after seven years, risking arrest
item.description: Former Catalan separatist leader Carles Puigdemont returned to Spain after seven years of self-imposed exile, defying a pending arrest warrant.

item.title: Deliveroo shares jump 10% after posting first-ever profit on 'inflection' in consumer demand
item.description: Deliveroo made a net profit of Â£1.3 million ($1.7 million) in the six months through June, bouncing from a loss last year.

item.title: India's Nifty 50 is outperforming the S&P 500 so far this year
item.description: The South Asian benchmark has surged 11.5% so far this year, outpacing the S&P 500's 8.7% gain, and crossed the 25,000 level for the first time last week.

item.title: China's exporters enjoyed the benefits of a weak yuan. Now that's changing and cutting into profits
item.description: Chinese companies seeking growth from exports face a new challenge: a strengthening yuan.

item.title: Delta says chaos after CrowdStrike outage cost it $380 million in revenue
item.description: Delta Air Lines on Thursday said last month's CrowdStrike outage and subsequent mass flight cancellations cost it some $550 million

item.title: Bitcoin's dizzying price movements make it a risky investment, say investing experts: 'It's pure, unadulterated speculation'
item.description: Bitcoin's rollercoaster price movements are a reminder why it shouldn't be a big part of your investment strategy, financial planners say.

item.title: Pressure mounting on Warner Bros. Discovery CEO David Zaslav to deliver value for shareholders
item.description: Warner Bros. Discovery could become a target for an activist shareholder if Zaslav doesn't start to deliver wins for shareholders.

item.title: Paramount Global announces it will cut 15% of U.S. workforce, shares rise on second-quarter earnings
item.description: Paramount Global plans to cut 15% of its U.S. workforce as part of a broader $500 million cost reduction.

item.title: Dolce & Gabbana launches $100 perfume for dogs inspired by owner's poodle
item.description: Dolce and Gabbana's luxury perfume for dogs â€” costing over $100 â€” has sparked concerns from some animal welfare organizations.

item.title: Advertising group suspends brand safety unit after Elon Musk's antitrust lawsuit
item.description: The World Federation of Advertisers said it's suspending operations of its Global Alliance for Responsible Media after Elon Musk's X filed an antitrust lawsuit.
